snippet.title: Barcelona faces end of winning era
snippet.description: Barring a drastic turn of fortune, Barcelona is on the brink of finishing its worst season since former coach Pep Guardiola molded it into one of the most successful teams to play soccer.

snippet.title: Reus, Liverpool top of AP soccer poll
snippet.description: Marco Reus leads the player vote for the second time, after scoring three goals in games against Real Madrid and Bayern Munich.

snippet.title: Is The Ronaldo Factor enough for Portugal?
snippet.description: The question facing Portugal at the Word Cup is plain: Can Cristiano Ronaldo do for his country what Diego Maradona did for Argentina at the 1986 tournament?

snippet.title: Valencia fights back from 3-0 down to win 5-3
snippet.description: Valencia fought back from a three-goal, first-leg deficit Thursday to beat Basel 5-0 and qualify for the Europa League semifinal, while competition favorite Juventus advanced after a tense 2-1 win at home to Lyon.

snippet.title: 5 Argentina players to watch at the World Cup
snippet.description: With a squad packed full of talent from Europe's top clubs, Argentina is certainly one of the title contenders at this year's World Cup.

snippet.title: Jonetta Rose Barras: Election-year budget from a lame-duck mayor
snippet.description: Vincent Gray's budget seeks to seal his legacy.

snippet.title: Howard among top goalkeepers in Premier League
snippet.description: If Tim Howard maintains the standard he's been setting in England, goalkeeping will be the least of the U.S. team's worries during the World Cup.

snippet.title: 5 Japan players to watch at the World Cup
snippet.description: Keisuke Honda and Shinji Kagawa will be called on to play key roles as Japan attempts to reach the next level at the World Cup.

snippet.title: Netherlands hoping to end World Cup winless streak
snippet.description: The Netherlands will head to Brazil hoping — again — to shake off the tag of best team never to win a World Cup.

snippet.title: Girls' soccer: W.T. Woodson starts the season on a roll
snippet.description: GIRLS' SOCCER | W.T. Woodson has focused on setting the tone with strong defense and fundamental offense, resulting in a 4-0 record and a scoring margin of 17-1.
